oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Confederate Col. William R. Peck to his sister following Battle of Gettysburg
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Col. Peck of the 9th La. Cav. Regt., CSA, describes in great detail the preceding days' action at the Battle of Gettysburg. The 4-page letter begins with the Army of Northern Virginia's first approach on July 1, 1863 to the small Pennsylvania town of Gettysburg and concludes with a recounting of local men lost on that "bloody field."
